contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox city Japan |Name= Nakatane |JapaneseName= 中種子町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Nakatane in Kagoshima Prefecture.png |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]] |District= [[Kumage District, Kagoshima|Kumage]] |Area_km2= 137.78 |PopDate= 2003 |Population= 9,473 |Density_km2= auto |Coords=30|31|23|N|130|57|10 |LatitudeDegrees= 30 |LatitudeMinutes= 31 |LatitudeSeconds= 23 |LongtitudeDegrees= 130 |LongtitudeMinutes= 57 |LongtitudeSeconds= 10 |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Nakatanega Kagoshima.JPG |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://town.nakatane.kagoshima.jp/ Town of Nakatane] }} [[Image:Nakatane01.jpg|thumb|Town Hall]] {{nihongo|'''Nakatane'''|中種子町|Nakatane-chō}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located on [[Tanegashima]] or Tanega Island in [[Kumage District, Kagoshima|Kumage District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 9,473 and the [[population density|density]] of 68.75 persons per km². The total area is 137.78 km². [[New Tanegashima Airport]] is located in Nakatane. Nakatane is featured in the [[Anime|Japanese animated]] [[feature film]], [[5 Centimeters Per Second]], directed by [[Makoto Shinkai]]. It was released on March 3, 2007 in Japan. ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} *[http://town.nakatane.kagoshima.jp/ Nakatane official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Towns in Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
